business.headline: Sensex, Nifty close higher on GST buzz, easing global tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 370.64 points, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 103.70 points to settle at 24,980.65. Broader markets also ended in the green, with mid- and small-cap stocks outperforming.

PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana: Who can get Rs 15,000 and other benefitsFirst-time employees under Part A can receive a one-time incentive equal to about one month's basic pay, up to Rs 15,000, paid in two instalments.

Two retirees, Rs 2 crore each, yet one runs out of money early. CA explains whyTwo retirees may have the same Rs 2 crore in savings, but their financial journeys can differ drastically. A CA explains how market timing and sequencing risk can decide who runs out of money first.

Are next-gen GST reforms a done deal?The next-gen GST overhaul could redefine India's tax landscape, but consensus among states and revenue concerns will decide its fate. For now, GST 2.0 is a promise, not a done deal. Read to know why.

ITR-U explained: Check eligibility, deadline, and penalties for updated returnsThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has made it simpler for taxpayers to correct errors in their income tax returns through the updated ITR-U. Here's a guide on who can file, the deadline, and possible penalties.

Why you should wait until October for big purchases, explains expertIf you've been planning to buy a car, air conditioner, or other expensive items, it might be wise to hold off for a few weeks. Expert says waiting until October could save you money thanks to upcoming GST reforms.

Why lower GST is better for your wallet than income tax reliefUnlike income tax, which applies only to those earning above a certain threshold, GST is an indirect tax levied on almost every transaction, covering nearly everything you buy.
How the SCL fire in Mohali sabotaged India's chip dreamsThe blaze caused losses estimated at Rs 75 crore in 1989, but the true cost the nation would pay would be known decades later.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares rose 7% in early tradeOla Electric's rising share price appears to be a result of renewed investor optimism, driven by the company's ambitious EV targets and gigafactory plans, but sustaining momentum will depend on market share recovery.

Sensex, Nifty gain as GST reforms buzz keeps investor sentiment bullishAt 9:21 am, the S&P BSE Sensex climbed 150.78 points to 81,424.53, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 38.15 points to 24,915.10. Most broader market indices also traded in the green during early deals, indicating improved investor sentiment.

Next-generation GST reforms will reduce tax burden, boost growth: CEAChief Economic Advisor Dr. V Anantha Nageshwaran said the GST overhaul, coupled with earlier tax cuts, will lower consumer costs, ease inflation, and boost disposable incomes, calling it a transformative step in India's eight-year tax reform journey

Received a fake income tax call? Key warning signs and tips to protect yourselfScammers are increasingly posing as income tax officials to trick people into sharing personal and financial information. If you receive a suspicious call during the filing season, it's important to stay calm and know the warning signs before taking any action.

entertainment.headline: Explained: Direct Action Day, Noakhali riots at the heart of The Bengal FilesAs Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Bengal Files' sparks debate, a look back at the violence of Direct Action Day and the Noakhali riots that shaped Bengal's partition.

Andhera actor Priya Bapat urges filmmakers not to typecast her in BollywoodActor Priya Bapat, in an exclusive conversation with India Today, spoke about being stereotyped in Bollywood. Proud of her Maharashtrian roots, the actor discussed how she wants to be seen beyond her identity.

Did India's Sakht Launda Zakir Khan just soften global borders for Hindi comedy?Zakir Khan's historic Hindi comedy show at Madison Square Garden marks a proud moment for Indian stand-up on the global stage. This breakthrough signals a new era where Indian humour, rooted in culture and relatability, is set to become a major cultural export like Bollywood.

Bigg Boss 19 confirmed contestants include Ashnoor Kaur, Gaurav Khanna and moreBigg Boss 19 is set to start on August 24 with Salman Khan as the host. The season features 15 confirmed celebrity contestants, which includes names like Gaurav Khanna, Ashnoor Kaur and Awez–Nagma.

Taarak Mehta to welcome new family, Asit Kumarr Modi teases more fun at Gokuldham'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' team is set to welcome a new family to the Gokuldham society. The show's creator, Asit Kumarr Modi, promised more entertainment.

BTS' Jimin enjoys beach day with V after his absence from Movie Weeks clip. WatchBTS ARMY were left stunned and emotional after a newly released band's Movie Weeks clip excluded Jimin's solo segment, prompting widespread disappointment and debate across social media.

Vishal Bhardwaj says he wrote poem on tissue for Priyanka Chopra to lift her moodFilmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj fondly recalls writing a poem on a tissue to cheer up Priyanka Chopra during the shooting of their film 'Kaminey', which completed 16 years of release on August 14.

Rukmini Vasanth says bagging a role in Kantara Chapter 1 was a dream come trueActor Rukmini Vasanth joined the cast of 'Kantara: Chapter 1'.  She described the opportunity as a dream come true as she shared the excitement and challenges of keeping the project a secret.

Thama teaser X reactions: Fans compare Ayushmann, Rashmika's vampire film to MCUFans have compared Ayushmann Khurrana, Rashmika Mandanna's 'Thama' teaser to Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). Viewers also praised Nawazuddin Siddiqui's appearance in the teaser.

Faissal Khan to legally separate from family: Will file petition in a month's timeAamir Khan's brother Faissal claimed that he will legally cut ties with his family. Faissal will file a petition in a month's time on the same.

Shruti on Kamal Haasan's reaction to Thug Life failure: Numbers don't affect himShruti Haasan, in a recent interview, recently opened up about how Kamal Haasan reacted to the failure of 'Thug Life', which marked his reunion with Mani Ratnam after 38 years. She explained how his father views cinema.

Gulshan Devaiah makes Kannada debut with Rishab's Kantara Chapter 1, poster outBollywood actor Gulshan Devaiah will be making his Kannada debut with Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1'. The makers made the announcement by unveiling his character's poster on social media.

It Ends With Us actor Isabela Ferrer alleges Justin Baldoni of bullyingActor Isabela Ferrer is facing legal challenges amid Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni's feud. Ferrer played young Lily in Baldoni's directorial 'It Ends With Us'.

Bigg Boss 19: Media house tour of Salman Khan's show hit by Mumbai rainsSalman Khan hosted 'Bigg Boss 19' is set to premiere on August 24. Ahead of the grand evening, the media tour of the house has been stalled due to Mumbai rains.

If Sholay was remade, who'd be Jai-Veeru: Sherlock Holmes investigatesA cult classic collides with a timeless sleuth. As Sholay marks half a century, Holmes and Watson debate who could possibly fill the boots of Jai and Veeru.

Who is Rachita Ram, the antagonist who stood out in Coolie's ensemble cast?Rachita Ram is a Kannada actor who made her feature film debut in 2013. She has featured in several hit films that involved some of the biggest names in the Kannada film industry, and recently made her Tamil debut in Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' as one of the antagonists, Kalyani.

Why Zakir Khan's stand-up at packed Madison Square Garden feels like personal successAt Madison Square Garden, Zakir Khan proved that dreams spoken in Hindi, with the accent of Indore and the honesty of a 'sakht launda', can be realised across the world. That standing ovation was a gratitude to Khan for being raw, real and unapologetically desi.

KBC 17: Factory worker wins Rs 25 lakh, shares dream of taking wife on Manali tripIn the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', a factory worker won Rs 25 lakh. After winning the amount, he shared his dreams of taking his wife to Manali.

We're safe: Rubina Dilaik updates fans after being stranded in Himachal rainsActor Rubina Dilaik expressed relief and gratitude after finding shelter in Himachal Pradesh amid heavy rain and landslides. The actor reassured fans on Instagram that she and her children are safe.

general news.headline: Mumbai gets 300 mm rain in a day, Devendra Fadnavis warns next 48 hours critical Live UpdatesAccording to Flightradar, 253 outbound and 163 inbound flights at Mumbai Airport were delayed, while Central Railway trains ran 20-30 minutes late.

Shubman Gill vice-captain, Jasprit Bumrah in as India announce Asia Cup squadShubman Gill has been named vice-captain to Suryakumar Yadav as India announced their 15-member squad for the upcoming Asia Cup in the UAE. The eight-team tournament will be held from September 9 to 28, with India placed in Group A alongside Oman, Pakistan, and the UAE.

Government to ban all money-based gaming transactions under Online Gaming Bill: SourcesUnder the proposed Regulation & Promotion of Online Gaming Act, banks and financial institutions will not be allowed to process or transfer funds for real-money online games.

With Sudershan Reddy, INDIA bloc's googly in vice-presidential contest with NDASources said the decision to field a candidate of "great credibility outside the political sphere" was intended to make it harder for regional parties to oppose.
Will Field Marshal Munir test a nuclear weapon?Army, Allah, America and the circumstances that will lead Field Marshal Asim Munir to invoke the fourth A - Atomic Weapons.

Oracle lays off 10 percent of India staff after Trump meet and OpenAI dealOracle, one of the world's biggest software companies, has let go of a large number of employees in India, with nearly 10 percent of its local workforce affected.

Pune-based builder's chopper with 6 aboard makes emergency landing amid rain, fogA private helicopter with six people on board made a safe emergency landing on a narrow road near Lonavala in Pune due to poor visibility from heavy rain and fog.

Modi set for SCO Summit, how fragile border peace tests India-China thaw"Differences must not become disputes nor competition conflicts," external affairs minister S. Jaishankar has emphasised to his visiting Chinese counterpart Wang Yi

Did India's Sakht Launda Zakir Khan just soften global borders for Hindi comedy?Zakir Khan's historic Hindi comedy show at Madison Square Garden marks a proud moment for Indian stand-up on the global stage. This breakthrough signals a new era where Indian humour, rooted in culture and relatability, is set to become a major cultural export like Bollywood.

Sudershan Reddy the jurist: From Salwa Judum verdict to Telangana caste censusFrom striking down Chhattisgarh's Salwa Judum militia, aimed at countering Naxalite activities with local tribal recruits, as unconstitutional, to criticising the Union government in 2011 for its laxity in investigating black money cases, the Opposition's VP pick, Sudershan Reddy, has been a jurist known for his firm stands. Most recently, as an expert, Reddy steered the Revanth Reddy-led Telangana caste census.

India-US ties frosty due to Trump comments, MAGA talks of ban on H-1B VisaEven as US President Donald Trump has ratcheted up his tariff talk against India, his MAGA base is drumming up for one more step to hit India — modify or ban H-1B Visa so that fewer Indians can get jobs in the US.

Rajasthan man's body stuffed in blue drum as son watches; wife, her lover arrestedThe 8-year-old boy told the police that his mother and Jitendra emptied a water-filled plastic drum, placed his father's body inside and hid the drum on the rooftop.

Dragon's classroom: Why China's takeover of UK schools should worry Indian parentsChinese investors are buying up Britain's venerable but often financially fragile private schools at an unprecedented rate, and it's time we asked the uncomfortable question: Is this just business, or is it a strategic move by the Chinese Communist Party?

The ghost of Super 301: Why US trade wrath always finds IndiaWhat started as President Trump's trade campaign against China seems now to be focused on India. This has a strange echo from 35 years ago, when the US started out to target Japan, its economic rival, with the Super 301 but ended up with India in its crosshairs. This is how the governments of Rajiv Gandhi and VP Singh reacted then.

Explained: Direct Action Day, Noakhali riots at the heart of The Bengal FilesAs Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Bengal Files' sparks debate, a look back at the violence of Direct Action Day and the Noakhali riots that shaped Bengal's partition.

Is loving a crime? Top court rejects plea challenging validity of minor's marriageIn its petition, the NCPCR challenged a decision of the Punjab and the Haryana High Court that held the love marriage between a 21-year-old Muslim man and a 16-year-old Muslim girl as valid under the provisions of the Muslim Personal Law.

Cornflakes 1, muesli 0, noodles -200: Expert rates India's favourite breakfastIs breakfast really the most important meal of the day? A nutrition expert breaks down common breakfast foods and reveals which ones fuel your body and which ones harm it.

Why Rahul Gandhi is silent on Tejashwi Yadav as Bihar chief minister pickOn Tuesday, Tejashwi Yadav announced Rahul Gandhi as the PM candidate for the 2029 Lok Sabha polls. However, Congress has refrained from projecting Tejashwi as the chief ministerial face. Here is why.

Expert deletes post on Maharashtra voters amid 'vote chori' row, faces BJP firePsephologist and Lokniti-CSDS co-director Sanjay Kumar's faulty data on voter surges in two Maharashtra seats—Nashik West and Hingna—has triggered a storm, amid Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's "vote-chori" allegations. Kumar deleted his post in which he shared the data, and apologised. The BJP attacked the expert and the Congress.

The 'living dead' of democracy: Has EC failed Bihar?Rahul Gandhi's tea with 'the dead' is a metaphor: Bihar's citizens were held to the strictest standards to prove they were alive. Declaring them dead needed just a shrug

Who is Sudershan Reddy, known for role in Justice Sen impeachment, Ambanis disputeFormer Supreme Court judge Sudershan Reddy has had a legal career spanning five decades. Here is everything you need to know about him.

BCCI stops reporter from asking Pakistan-related questionIndian cricket team chief selector Ajit Agarkar was stopped from responding to questions about Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2025 squad announcement. The BCCI representative at the meeting shut the question down.

Bigg Boss 19 confirmed contestants include Ashnoor Kaur, Gaurav Khanna and moreBigg Boss 19 is set to start on August 24 with Salman Khan as the host. The season features 15 confirmed celebrity contestants, which includes names like Gaurav Khanna, Ashnoor Kaur and Awez–Nagma.

CBSE's open-book exams could end the era of rote learning in schoolsCBSE's new open-book exam plan for Class 9 marks a decisive shift away from rote memorisation, pushing students toward critical thinking and application-based learning. Piloted successfully, the reform is now set to reshape classrooms, teaching styles, and exam preparation across India.

Malayalam actor Pala Suresh dies of cardiac arrest at 53Suresh Krishna, popularly known as Pala Suresh, reportedly had a heart condition and was undergoing treatment at Kottayam Medical College. He was found in an unresponsive state at his residence and was pronounced dead upon arrival at the hospital.

Exclusive: Salman, Sonali's Prem-Preeti reunion on Bigg Boss 19 - Here's all we knowActor Salman Khan will be joined by his 'Hum Saath-Saath Hain' co-star Sonali Bendre at 'Bigg Boss 19' premiere. Sonali will be present at the show to promote her new reality series 'Pati Patni Aur Panga'.

Explained: Direct Action Day, Noakhali riots at the heart of The Bengal FilesAs Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Bengal Files' sparks debate, a look back at the violence of Direct Action Day and the Noakhali riots that shaped Bengal's partition.

Andhera actor Priya Bapat urges filmmakers not to typecast her in BollywoodActor Priya Bapat, in an exclusive conversation with India Today, spoke about being stereotyped in Bollywood. Proud of her Maharashtrian roots, the actor discussed how she wants to be seen beyond her identity.

sports.headline: Shafali snubbed, Renuka returns: Talking points from India Women's World Cup squadIndia named their 15-member squad for the Women's ODI World Cup 2025, with Harmanpreet Kaur as captain and Smriti Mandhana as vice-captain. The tournament begins on September 30, and with home advantage, India will chase their first-ever title after twice finishing runners-up.

Jaiswal should be in T20I team for next World Cup: Gambhir's old video goes viralAn old video of India head coach Gautam Gambhir has been going viral on social media, where he's asking for Yashasvi Jaiswal's selection in the T20I squad. The clip is gaining traction in the aftermath of Jaiswal's Asia Cup 2025 snub.

Sanju Samson played as Gill, Jaiswal were unavailable in T20Is: Ajit AgarkarThe BCCI chairman of selectors, Ajit Agarkar, made a startling revelation that Sanju Samson was only playing T20 internationals as the likes of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill were unavailable.

India's Asia Cup squad explained: Who's in and who missed out?India's Asia Cup 2025 squad blends experience, in-form talent, and strategic selections. Shubman Gill returns as vice-captain, Jasprit Bumrah leads the pace attack, while Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shreyas Iyer miss out, highlighting team balance priorities.

Asia Cup: Ajit Agarkar explains Shubman Gill's return, Shreyas Iyer's exclusionSpeaking after announcing India's Asia Cup 2025 squad, selection committee chairman Ajit Agarkar and captain Suryakumar Yadav explained the selection calls. Shubman Gill returned to the 15-man squad as vice-captain while Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal were dropped.

Hardik Pandya's aura and leadership are invaluable: Abhishek NayarFormer India coach Abhishek Nayar believes that Hardik Pandya remains an invaluable asset to Team India as they gear up for the Asia Cup 2025. He suggested that, alongside his all-round contributions to the field, he brings the added element of leadership as well to the mix.

Shafali Verma still on our radar, says India women's selector after World Cup snubIndia women's cricket team chief selector Neetu David has said that Shafali Verma is still on their radar despite snubbing her from the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 squad.

Will vice-captain Shubman Gill start for India in Asia Cup? Agarkar explainsShubman Gill's appointment as India's T20I vice-captain for the Asia Cup 2025 sparks debate over his place in the starting XI, as Ajit Agarkar and the selectors weigh form, hierarchy, and a settled top order.

Renuka Singh returns in India squad for Women's World Cup, Australia ODIsIndia have included Renuka Singh Thakur as India named their squads for the Women's ODI World Cup and the three-match ODI series against Australia. Shafali Verma, however, didn't find a place in the team for both the series.

India want Bumrah for big tournaments, no fixed workload plans: AgarkarAjit Agarkar clarified that Jasprit Bumrah's workload management is not a fixed ordeal. He suggested that India sees him as a key player who they want to take part, especially when it comes to the big games.

Not their fault, not ours: Agarkar explains Yashasvi and Shreyas Asia Cup snubAsia Cup 2025: Ajit Agarkar clarified the reasons behind Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shreyas Iyer missing out on India's squad. India's campaign in the tournament starts on September 10 in Dubai.

Shafali Verma still on our radar, says India women's selector after World Cup snubIndia women's cricket team chief selector Neetu David has said that Shafali Verma is still on their radar despite snubbing her from the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 squad.

Will vice-captain Shubman Gill start for India in Asia Cup? Agarkar explainsShubman Gill's appointment as India's T20I vice-captain for the Asia Cup 2025 sparks debate over his place in the starting XI, as Ajit Agarkar and the selectors weigh form, hierarchy, and a settled top order.

Renuka Singh returns in India squad for Women's World Cup, Australia ODIsIndia have included Renuka Singh Thakur as India named their squads for the Women's ODI World Cup and the three-match ODI series against Australia. Shafali Verma, however, didn't find a place in the team for both the series.

India want Bumrah for big tournaments, no fixed workload plans: AgarkarAjit Agarkar clarified that Jasprit Bumrah's workload management is not a fixed ordeal. He suggested that India sees him as a key player who they want to take part, especially when it comes to the big games.

Not their fault, not ours: Agarkar explains Yashasvi and Shreyas Asia Cup snubAsia Cup 2025: Ajit Agarkar clarified the reasons behind Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shreyas Iyer missing out on India's squad. India's campaign in the tournament starts on September 10 in Dubai.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
